vossen_en_konijnen.model.actor

Class Grass

  • java.lang.Object
    • vossen_en_konijnen.model.actor.Grass
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Actor

    public class Grass
extends java.lang.Object
implements Actor
    A simple model of a grass. Grass age, multiply and die.
    Version:
    2011.07.31
    Author:
    Bor D., Mulder F., Scholten R.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Grass

        public Grass(boolean randomAge,
             Field field,
             Location location)
        Create a new grass. A grass may be created with age zero (a new born) or with a random age.
        Parameters:
        randomAge - If true, the grass will have a random age.
        field - The field currently occupied.
        location - The location within the field.

    • Method Detail

      • act

        public void act(java.util.List<Actor> newGrass)
        This is what the rabbit does most of the time - it runs around. Sometimes it will breed or die of old age.
        Specified by:
        act in interface Actor
        Parameters:
        newGrass - A list to return newly born rabbits.

        public void setDead()

        Returns:

      • goMultiply

        private void goMultiply(java.util.List<Actor> newGrass)
        Check whether or not this grass is to multiply at this step. New multiplies will be made into free adjacent locations.
        Parameters:
        newGrass - A list to return newly created grasses.

      • canMultiply

        protected boolean canMultiply()
        Return if grass can multiply.

        if grass can multiply.
